Nadiem Buat Aplikasi Pendidikan, Pakar LIPI: Perhatikan Ekosistem
06 Nov 2019, 06:58 by Moh Khory Alfarizi, Yudono Yanuar
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Peneliti dari Pusat Penelitian Kependudukan LIPI Anggi Afriansyah menanggapi rencana Menteri Pendidikan dan Kebudayaan Nadiem Makarim untuk membuat aplikasi pendidikan. Anggi berpendapat bahwa aplikasi menjadi penting ketika dilakukan di wilayah yang infrastrukturnya memadai.
"Aplikasi pendidikan itu menjadi penting ketika operasionalnya dilakukan di wilayah yang akses internetnya memadai. Artinya bukan hanya aplikasi tapi bagaimana aplikasi itu harus dioperasionalkan di semua daerah," ujar Anggi Kepada Tempo melalui sambungan telepon, Rabu, 6 November 2019.
Sebelumnya, Presiden Joko Widodo atau Jokowi menceritakan bahwa Nadiem meminta waktu 100 hari kepadanya untuk membuat perubahan sistem belajar berbasis aplikasi.
"Mas menteri minta 'beri waktu saya pak 100 hari untuk menyiapkan dan merancang itu'," kata Presiden Jokowi dalam acara diskusi mingguan dengan wartawan kepresidenan di Istana Merdeka Jakarta, Jumat, 1 November 2019.
Presiden menyebut "Mas Menteri" merujuk kepada mantan CEO Gojek berusia 35 tahun tersebut.
Selain infrastruktur yang bisa mendukung aplikasi, kata Anggi, guru juga harus diperhatikan kualitasnya. "Secanggih apapun aplikasi kalau gurunya tidak paham ya percuma. Kalau bicara teknologi ya harus memperhatikan soal guru, sarana dan prasarannya," tutur Anggi.
Namun, Anggi melanjutkan, persoalan utama di pendidikan itu adalah tentang rumitnya kurikulum. Kalau bicara pendidikan, Anggi berujar, dalam beberapa aspek Indonesia mengalami perubahan berulang mengenai kurikulum, ada KTSP sampai sekarang Kurikulum 13.
Menurut Anggi PR pendidikan di Indonesia tidak hanya soal aplikasi, karena membuat aplikasi itu persoalan mudah, mengingat Menteri sekarang sudah sangat sukses dan terkenal membangun Gojek dengan aplikasinya.
"Tapi bagaimana sarana prasarananya. Jadi kalau pendidikan bicara ekosistem tidak terlepas dari infrastruktur. Kita di pendidikan Indonesia ini lebih ribut di masalah administrasi tapi tidak ke masalah yang substansi," ujar Anggi.

Nadiem Creates Educational Applications, LIPI Experts: Pay Attention to Ecosystems
Nov 6 2019, 06:58 by Moh Khory Alfarizi, Yudono Yanuar
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Researchers from the LIPI Population Research Center Anggi Afriansyah responded to the plan of the Minister of Education and Culture Nadiem Makarim to make an educational application. Anggi believes that applications are important when carried out in areas with adequate infrastructure.
"The educational application becomes important when its operations are carried out in areas with adequate internet access. This means that it is not only the application but how the application must be operational in all regions," Anggi told Tempo by telephone, Wednesday, November 6, 2019.
Previously, President Joko Widodo or Jokowi said that Nadiem asked him 100 days to make changes to the application-based learning system.
"Mas minister asked 'give me 100 days to prepare and design it,'" President Jokowi said in a weekly discussion with presidential reporters at the Merdeka Palace in Jakarta, Friday, November 1, 2019.
The president called "Mas Minister" referring to the 35-year-old former CEO of Gojek.
In addition to infrastructure that can support applications, Anggi said, teachers must also pay attention to their quality. "No matter how sophisticated the application, if the teacher does not understand, it is useless. When it comes to technology, we must pay attention to the teacher, its facilities and infrastructure," Anggi said.
However, Anggi continued, the main problem in education was about the complexity of the curriculum. When it comes to education, Anggi said, in some aspects of Indonesia experiencing repeated changes regarding the curriculum, there is an SBC until now Curriculum 13.
According to Anggi PR education in Indonesia is not only about the application, because making the application is an easy matter, considering the Minister is now very successful and famous for building Gojek with his application.
"But what about infrastructure facilities. So if education talks about ecosystems, it cannot be separated from infrastructure. We in Indonesian education are noisier in administrative matters but not in substance matters," Anggi said.
